body_html:
As per this doc - https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/relu
Relu function computes rectified linear: max(features, 0), so I tried computing maximum value

x = np.zeros(2) + np.nan   // x = [nan nan]
np.maximum(x, 0)              // OK on both the platform (X86 and ppc64le)
sess.run(tf.maximum(x, 0))  // fails on ppc64le  returns [0. 0.] VS expected [nan nan]

Anyone has any idea ?
body_text:
As per this doc - https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/relu
Relu function computes rectified linear: max(features, 0), so I tried computing maximum value
x = np.zeros(2) + np.nan   // x = [nan nan]
np.maximum(x, 0)              // OK on both the platform (X86 and ppc64le)
sess.run(tf.maximum(x, 0))  // fails on ppc64le  returns [0. 0.] VS expected [nan nan]

Anyone has any idea ?
body:
As per this doc - https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/relu
Relu function computes rectified linear: `max(features, 0)`, so I tried computing maximum value 

```
x = np.zeros(2) + np.nan   // x = [nan nan]
np.maximum(x, 0)              // OK on both the platform (X86 and ppc64le)
sess.run(tf.maximum(x, 0))  // fails on ppc64le  returns [0. 0.] VS expected [nan nan]
```

Anyone has any idea ?
